item.title: Call of Duty Black Ops 7 Was US’s Best Selling Game in November 2025
item.content:encoded:
Video game sales data for November 2025 has been released, and Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 has been crowned as the best-selling title of the month.

The latest sales data comes from Mat Piscatella, the Senior Director & Video Game Industry Thought Leader at Circana. Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 has taken the crown from Battlefield 6, which is closely chasing at the number two spot.

The rest of the top 5 games of November 2025 are as follows: Battlefield 6 in second place, followed by three sports-based titles: NBA 2K26, Madden NFL 26, and EA Sports FC 26. Coming to new releases, there were only three fresh games that joined the top 20 list, including Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 at number 1, Kirby Air Riders making it to the top 10 by an inch, and Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment at number 11.

Readers can check out the complete list of the best-selling games for November 2025 below, and leave their thoughts on Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 being the top game for the month down in the comments below. And don’t forget to join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

Best Selling Games for November 2025

  1. Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 — Microsoft (Corp)
  2. Battlefield 6 — Electronic Arts
  3. NBA 2K26 — Take-Two Interactive
  4. Madden NFL 26 — Electronic Arts
  5. EA Sports FC 26 — Electronic Arts
  6. Pokémon Legends Z-A — Nintendo
  7. Ghost of Yotei — Sony (Corp)
  8. EA Sports College Football 26 — Electronic Arts
  9. Minecraft — Multiple Video Game Publishers
  10. Kirby Air Riders — Nintendo
  11. Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment — Nintendo
  12. The Outer Worlds 2 — Microsoft (Corp)
  13. Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds — Sega
  14. Donkey Kong Bananza — Nintendo
  15. Marvel’s Spider-Man 2 — Sony (Corp)
  16. Red Dead Redemption 2 — Take-Two Interactive
  17. Grand Theft Auto 5 — Take-Two Interactive
  18. Borderlands 4 — Take-Two Interactive
  19. Forza Horizon 5 — Microsoft (Corp)
  20. Digimon Story: Time Stranger — Bandai Namco Entertainment

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about the Dispatch Nintendo Switch and Switch 2 release date being revealed through the eShop listing. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Dispatch Nintendo Switch and Switch 2 Release Date Revealed Through eShop Listing
item.content:encoded:
Dispatch is coming to Nintendo Switch and Switch 2 on January 29, 2026, according to an Australian eShop listing.

The new episodic adventure from AdHoc Studios, Dispatch, quickly found popularity among gamers, reaching 2 million copies sold in less than a month. The title was also called the Game of the Year by The Witcher 3’s director. Now, the developers are expanding the title’s reach, bringing it to more platforms.

Dispatch Arriving for Switch and Switch 2 in January 2026

Although we are yet to receive an official announcement for Dispatch’s release on the Switch and Switch 2, we already know the launch date. Spotted by Vooks, the Australian Nintendo eShop has been updated with a new listing for Dispatch with the January 2026 release date. Players who purchase the Nintendo Switch edition can get the upgrade pack for free, which includes enhanced resolution and improved frame rates.

For those unaware, Dispatch is a superhero workplace comedy by the writers and directors of Tales from the Borderlands and The Wolf Among Us. You play as Robert Robertson, also known as Mecha Man, who, after a defeat against his nemesis, has been reduced to a dispatcher. Your job is to review ongoing emergencies and deploy the right heroes to deal with them. Every decision the player makes influences the narrative, so make your choices wisely. It also features a star-studded cast, including names like Aaron Paul, MoistCr1TiKaL, Jacksepticeye, Alanah Pearce, and more.

In other news, check out Insider Gaming’s interview with the Dispatch developers. Additionally, here’s a review of the first two episodes. What are your thoughts on Dispatch releasing for Switch and Switch 2? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about more Pokémon TCG Ascended Heroes secret rares being revealed in Japan. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
